Uses of Class
xxl.core.spatial.points.FloatPoint

Packages that use FloatPoint
xxl.core.spatial.cursors Provides mappers for different type of Point and Rectangle objects as well as several join algorithms: nested loops distance similarity-join for Points, the spatial join algorithm based on space-filling curves proposed by Jack Orenstein, similarity-join algorithm "GESS: Generic External Space Sweep" and hash-based plane sweep for two-dimensional data. 
xxl.core.spatial.points Implemetns the base type Point for all data that deals with points of arbitrary dimensions and wrappers for double[], float[] and fixed-mantissa points. 
xxl.core.spatial.rectangles Implemetns the base type Rectangle for high-dimensional rectangle objects (hyper-cubes) and extentions for different coordinate types (double, float, long). 
 

Uses of FloatPoint in xxl.core.spatial.cursors
 

Methods in xxl.core.spatial.cursors that return types with arguments of type FloatPoint
static Cursor<FloatPoint> Mappers.mapKPEToFloatPoint(java.util.Iterator<? extends KPE> iterator, boolean corner)
          Return a mapper mapping an input iterator of KPEs containing a Rectangle as data item to Points.
static Cursor<FloatPoint> Mappers.mapPointToFloatPoint(java.util.Iterator<? extends Point> iterator)
          Returns a Mapper mapping an Iterator of DoublePoints to an Iterator of FloatPoints.
static Cursor<FloatPoint> Mappers.mapPointToUnitCube(java.util.Iterator<? extends Point> iterator, Rectangle universe)
          Returns a Mapper transforming a given Iterator of FloatPoints to the unit-cube [0;1)^dim assuming that all Points are inside the given universe-FloatPointRectangle and that the Points are of type FloatPoint.
